Text: Re Trading AuthorityThanks for the procedures We need to add Theres Branney to the list of people that can trade She is now trading in the storage group in the same capacity as Morgan and myself We are all extremely confident of her knowledge and ability to do these trades Is there anyone I need to contact to get her name added to this trading authority Sue From Drew Fossum PM To Kent MillerET NRON Sue M NevilleET NRON Morgan GottsponerET NRON cc Rod NRON Dave NeubauerET NRON Bob ChandlerET NRON Michael MoranET NRON Danny McCartyET nron Subject Trading Authority Per your request Kent Ive talked to Rod and confirmed with him the procedures we need to be following on all trading activity until we complete final ETS derivative trading rules and procedures For any financial trades always check with Bob before executing the trade regarding FAS hedge treatment Rod emphasized the fluid nature of the FAS interpretations so getting the experts involved early is critical If we decide a trade ought to qualify for hedge accounting the key facts need to be written up and given to the auditors for sign off on the same day the trade is executed For trades that qualify as hedges in addition to above Kent and Dave Nuebauer need to sign off on the trade For trades that dont qualify as hedges a higher level of approval is essential Until we get a formal set of rules in place and are up and running with our ability to calculate VAR etc I would suggest that all trades must be approved by Danny and Rod I would also suggest that legal approval be obtained from either me or Mike Moran Sue and Morgan should be allowed to enter into trades as well as Kent consistent with the above guidelines Enron does not require that all trades be executed by officers and that approach should work here also so long as items are adhered to I believe these rules are clear and can be adhered to without much interpretation or administrative burden If anyone has a concern regarding this approach please give me a call DF

Out of Office AutoReplyI am on vacation until January rd pm If this is urgent please contact Preston Roobaert x for assistance Thanks Sue Neville

RE FDD Status for Dec th Cc Thanks Sue Original Message From Bodnar Michael Sent Friday December AM To Blair Lynn Cc Neville Sue Thomas Steve Subject RE FDD Status for Dec th Yes I have been monitoring BPs FDD balance Sherry and Chris have been working with someone at BP filling in for the regular vacationing BP scheduler and who is unfamiliar with FDD service Chris and Sherry have taken the over scheduled FDD and rescheduled it into BPs IDD account Currently BPs FDD is within contract parameters and I will continue to monitor all FDD balances Original Message From Blair Lynn Sent Friday December AM To Bodnar Michael Subject FW FDD Status for Dec th Are you up to speed on this We need to discuss Thanks Lynn Original Message From Neville Sue Sent Wednesday December PM To Blair Lynn Cc Thomas Steve Subject FW FDD Status for Dec th Lynn Can you please check into BP Canada injecting more than their FDD contract quantity What can be done now What processes do we need to put in place to prevent that from happening in the future Thanks Sue Original Message From Thomas Steve Sent Wednesday December PM To Susan M nron Michael nron Raetta nron Bowers Janet Wilkinson Chuck Brennan Lorna Penkava Loren Dushinske John Sebesta Chris Pavlou Larry Bollinger Joni Lagerstrom Karen Stevens Bob Semin Frank Williams Jo Lantefield Laura Barry Mike Fowler Bill Berg Vicki Pritchard John Fiscus John Johanson Tim Oldenhuis Frank Williams John Paladino Ranelle Cc Kent nron Kay nron Steele Patricia Trevino Linda Darveaux Mary Neubauer Dave Brostad Karen Carter Zuela Bolks Sean Kirk Steve Cabrera Reyna Gottsponer Morgan Thomas Steve Roobaert Preston Cohrs Allen Subject FDD Status for Dec th Attached is the latest FDD status report as of December th Tabs showing FDD activity for this time period for the last three years is also included The GIP contracts should be at to be on target to get to the max allowable contract quantity for the end of December The max target amount for GIP accounts by the end of December is The average remaining balance for all GIP contracts is To get to the tariff limit of by Jan st the GIP contracts will have to withdrawal about Bcf or mmcfd over the next days The step step do not have a minimum requirement to be met by the end of December since minimum withdrawals for NovDec is zero The last report stated that EntergyKoch had switched to GIP from step This was in error They are still in the step process BP Canada has injected of their contract amount They have of GIP on a contract of The percentage break out by service is GIP Step and Step Overall FDD is full If you have any questions please call me Steve Thomas Gas Storage Manager File FDDDEC xls

FW FDD Status for Dec th Cc Lynn Can you please check into BP Canada injecting more than their FDD contract quantity What can be done now What processes do we need to put in place to prevent that from happening in the future Thanks Sue Original Message From Thomas Steve Sent Wednesday December PM To Susan M nron Michael nron Raetta nron Bowers Janet Wilkinson Chuck Brennan Lorna Penkava Loren Dushinske John Sebesta Chris Pavlou Larry Bollinger Joni Lagerstrom Karen Stevens Bob Semin Frank Williams Jo Lantefield Laura Barry Mike Fowler Bill Berg Vicki Pritchard John Fiscus John Johanson Tim Oldenhuis Frank Williams John Paladino Ranelle Cc Kent nron Kay nron Steele Patricia Trevino Linda Darveaux Mary Neubauer Dave Brostad Karen Carter Zuela Bolks Sean Kirk Steve Cabrera Reyna Gottsponer Morgan Thomas Steve Roobaert Preston Cohrs Allen Subject FDD Status for Dec th Attached is the latest FDD status report as of December th Tabs showing FDD activity for this time period for the last three years is also included The GIP contracts should be at to be on target to get to the max allowable contract quantity for the end of December The max target amount for GIP accounts by the end of December is The average remaining balance for all GIP contracts is To get to the tariff limit of by Jan st the GIP contracts will have to withdrawal about Bcf or mmcfd over the next days The step step do not have a minimum requirement to be met by the end of December since minimum withdrawals for NovDec is zero The last report stated that EntergyKoch had switched to GIP from step This was in error They are still in the step process BP Canada has injected of their contract amount They have of GIP on a contract of The percentage break out by service is GIP Step and Step Overall FDD is full If you have any questions please call me Steve Thomas Gas Storage Manager

RE PNR Balance on PNM Cr PO Cc I would recommend that we just have them nominate it out when it is convenient for TW and not charge them any additional fees Is there a procedure in place that will prevent us from missing a balance like this again Sue Original Message From Bodnar Michael Sent Friday October PM To Watson Kimberly Neville Sue Lohman TK Cc Blair Lynn Hanagriff Richard McEvoy Christine Giambrone Laura Subject PNR Balance on PNM Cr PO In analyzing shipper imbalance statements Laura Giambrone discovered a PNR balance of Dth on the above noted contract The balance was parked on TW on April and PNM paid a per Dthd fee in that month TW has not billed PNR fees on the balance since May PNM has not inquired about nor nominated the redelivery of the quantities held by TW How should this matter be handled

RE italyHer email address is The first two letters of her email are v v not w as it look It stands for Virgil and Verla She said they are having trouble with their email a lot this last week Her phone number is h c By the way her birthday is Thursday the th if you talk to her Good luck Sue Original Message From Watson Kimberly Sent Tuesday September AM To Neville Sue Subject italy Sue Have you talked to your mom since last week I would like to visit with her by phone or email about what her viewsopinions are of the local viewpoints of the WTC tragedy May I have her phone number and email address again Thanks Kim
